meanings.definition: To send or deliver (something) to the wrong recipient or location.
meanings.sent1: The mail carrier mispatched the package to the neighbor's house.
meanings.sent2: I hope I don't mispatch this important document to the wrong department.
meanings.sent3: The mispatched letter ended up in the wrong mailbox, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: Her message got mispatched, landing in the spam folder instead of the inbox.
meanings.sent5: The mispatched delivery led to a mix-up that took days to resolve.

meanings.sent1: The mispatched socks had different patterns on each foot.
meanings.sent2: She realized the mispatched colors of the puzzle pieces didn't fit together.
meanings.sent3: The mispatched outfits made them stand out at the party in a unique way.
meanings.sent4: The mispatched puzzle pieces created a beautiful, unexpected design.
meanings.sent5: The mispatched furniture gave the room a quirky and eclectic vibe.
